University of Northern Colorado is a great college full of a mixed and diverse student body.
Skiing on the weekend and eating at the local restaurants like Cheba Hut and the Texas Roadhouse
* Bring cold weather clothing * Have a skateboard for easy transportation to classes * Lock your valuables up in your dorm room

University of Northern Colorado is a great place for students looking for a mid size college with small teacher to students ratios. The tuition is affordable and the campus is old school style. I am proud to be a UNC bear!
pageTitle: University of Northern Colorado Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {196004=this year which is 2011 was my first year and from my experience it turn out to be a amazing school., 100611=As a college freshman I would advise prospective UNC students to keep your grades up in High School. Grades as well as extracurricular activities will get you into UNC. Stay out of trouble as well, enjoy your senior year of high school, but do not get into trouble because you do not want to miss out on a great college experience especially at UNC. The last thing to let you know is apply for financial aid. Get as much as you possibly can even if they are loans. Do not let money keep you from attending UNC. If you have financial aid questions the UNC Financial Aid office will help you. UNC Also gives out grants and scholarships to incoming freshmen. They have a Universal scholarship application that you can fill out in January once you create an Ursa account. Again to get those scholarships and grants you need the grades and extracurricular activities. YOU REALLY NEED TO FILL OUT A FASFA FORM AS WELL!!!, 484780=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Students interested in acting, Students interested in education, Students interested in music, and Students who prefer an isolated yet urban environment. Tips for prospective students My tips for prospective students would be to prepare ahead of time for what may come, and to visit the campus, as they may be able to feel the community vibe that UNC carries. Bang for the buck One of my primary reasons for attending UNC in the first place stems from all that I had heard about the Performance Arts program here. UNC may not be the best acting school in the country (if you're looking for that, I'd suggest an observatory), but considering the price, I do believe that it presents one of the best values in the country for this sort of thing. UNC provides skilled training at an affordable cost. Am enjoying being here So far at UNC I have made solid friends, been involved in two groups for improvisational comedy, developed a love for philosophy as a subject, and experienced a sense of individuality that I don't think I've ever known before. It really is something special when you realize that you're living through what will one day be
